title: [Android, 3.116.1] SKGLView touch events are not on the main thread on Android
body:
### Description

On Android, SKGLView Touch events are not raised on the main thread. I don't think the touch event needs to be on the GLThread or the like to improve performance, like is the case with PaintSurface possibly. If you interact with anything in the UI from this thread, which may be expected based on this being a Touch event, this may result in a random crash. Sentry reports segfault at android::IPCThreadState::joinThreadPool and subsequent thread aborts. By contrast, Touch event is raised on the main thread on Windows and iOS for both SKCanvasView and SKGLView, and also for SKCanvasView on Android, so SKGLView on Android is again an isolated exception.

### Code

No code, just observed this with our game GnollHack.

### Expected Behavior

Touch events are raised on the main thread in all cases, also with SKGLView on Android.

### Actual Behavior

Touch event handler is called from a thread different from the main thread on Android for SKGLView.

### Version of SkiaSharp

3.116.0 (Current)

### Last Known Good Version of SkiaSharp

Unknown

### IDE / Editor

Visual Studio (Windows)

### Platform / Operating System

Android

### Platform / Operating System Version
